section.p: The video module is disabled by default, call this method to enable it. If you need to disable the video module later, you need to call .

section.title: Call timing
section.p:
This method can be called either before joining a channel or while in the channel:
If called before joining a channel, it enables the video module.
If called during an audio-only call, the audio call automatically switches to a video call.

ul.li: This method enables the internal engine and is valid after leaving the channel.

Calling this method will reset the entire engine, resulting in a slow response time. Instead of callling this method, you can independently control a specific video module based on your actual needs using the following methods:
: Whether to enable the camera to create the local video stream.
: Whether to publish the local video stream.
: Whether to subscribe to and play the remote video stream.
: Whether to subscribe to and play all remote video streams.
A successful call of this method resets , , and . Proceed it with caution.

section.title: Related callbacks
section.p: A successful call of this method triggers the callback on the remote client.
When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.props: native unreal bp electron unity rn cs
ul.li: < 0: Failure. See for details and resolution suggestions.
